page.description: Returns the number of records in a query for a table or a set. To pass in arguments, set OpDefn.arguments = argument object
page.syntax: Record_Count as N = a5_get_records_in_query(C table_set_name ,C filter_expression [,N session_handle[,L count_child_records [,* OpDefn ]]])

argument.name: table_set_name
argument.description: The name of the table or set. Include the ".set" suffix when working with a set.

argument.name: filter_expression
argument.description: A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value. Selects records.

argument.name: count_child_records
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = Count child records.
.F. = Count only parent records.

page.discussion: The A5_GET_RECORDS_IN_QUERY() function returns the number of records in the specified table or set that satisfy a query expression.

section.description: This is a good way to test if a table is empty. Assuming the table's name is customer :
